title: ICE with static and const_fn

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
when initalizing a static using a const_fn that returns a pointer to the interior of the static, rustc panics.

```rust
#![feature(const_fn)]

struct S(pub &'static u32, pub u32);

const fn g(ss: &S) -> &u32 { &ss.1 }

static s: S = S(g(&s), 0);

fn main () { }
```

instead of `s` being initialized with a reference to its interior, the compiler panics:

```

 --> foo.rs:5:30
  |
5 | const fn g(ss: &S) -> &u32 { &ss.1 }
  |                              ^^^^^
```
